hero.title: Your Personalized Entry-Level Full-Stack Engineer Roadmap is Ready!

radarAxes.label: Skills
radarAxes.title: Skill Breadth
radarAxes.description: Percentage of full-stack skills you've selected. Shows how well-rounded you are across frontend and backend.

radarAxes.label: DSA
radarAxes.title: Data Structures & Algorithms
radarAxes.description: Problem-solving ability. Essential for technical interviews and logic building.

radarAxes.label: Frontend
radarAxes.title: Frontend Development
radarAxes.description: Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React. Build responsive user interfaces.

radarAxes.label: Backend
radarAxes.title: Backend Development
radarAxes.description: Server-side development with Node.js, Express, APIs, and databases.

radarAxes.label: DevOps
radarAxes.title: DevOps & Deployment
radarAxes.description: Git, deployment, Docker basics, and cloud fundamentals.

easy: Strengthen both frontend (React) and backend (Node.js) fundamentals
Build 2-3 full-stack projects showcasing end-to-end development
Practice building APIs and connecting them to React frontends
doable: Build solid DSA foundation - solve 50+ LeetCode problems
Master MERN stack (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js)
Create full-stack projects with auth, databases, and deployment
challenging: DSA practice is critical - aim for 100+ problems across patterns
Deep understanding of both frontend and backend architecture
Build impressive portfolio with production-quality full-stack apps
stretch: Plan for 6+ months of dedicated preparation
Master full-stack development and DSA thoroughly
Consider specializing in frontend or backend first, then expand

rounds.name: Online Assessment
points: 2-3 coding problems focusing on JavaScript algorithms and data structures
Common topics: arrays, strings, objects, basic recursion, and async patterns
May include full-stack MCQs on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, databases
Time management is key - aim to complete all problems

rounds.name: Machine Coding Round
points: Build a complete full-stack feature from scratch (e.g., todo app with backend API)
Frontend: React component with proper state management and API integration
Backend: REST API endpoints with database operations (CRUD)
Working functionality and clean code matter more than perfect design

rounds.name: Technical Interview (DSA)
points: 1-2 easy-to-medium DSA problems with live coding
Focus on arrays, strings, hash maps, and basic tree/graph traversal
Explain your approach and discuss time/space complexity
May include JavaScript-specific questions (closures, promises, event loop)

rounds.name: Technical Interview (Full-Stack)
points: Frontend: React concepts (hooks, state management, component lifecycle)
Backend: Node.js, Express, REST API design, database queries
Questions on authentication, API security, error handling
Build a small full-stack feature live and explain your design choices

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Cultural Fit
points: Discussion about past projects and your role in them
Behavioral questions on teamwork, learning, and handling feedback
Why this company and role? Show genuine interest in full-stack work
Ask thoughtful questions about team structure and growth opportunities

easy: Keep practicing DSA regularly to stay sharp
Network and seek referrals to improve chances
doable: DSA fundamentals are essential - solve 75+ problems
Master MERN/MEAN stack and modern full-stack tooling
Prepare for machine coding rounds with timed full-stack practice
challenging: Strong DSA is mandatory - aim for 120+ problems
Deep understanding of full-stack architecture and best practices
Referrals significantly improve your chances - start networking
stretch: This requires 6-8 months of focused preparation
DSA mastery is non-negotiable at this level
Consider building more experience before targeting unicorns

rounds.name: Online Assessment
points: 3-4 coding problems ranging from easy to medium difficulty
Focus on JavaScript/Node.js problem-solving and algorithmic thinking
May include full-stack challenges (API design, database queries)
Passing score typically 60-70% to proceed to interviews

rounds.name: DSA Round 1
points: 1-2 medium problems on arrays, strings, or hash maps
Expected to arrive at optimal solution with hints
Code on shared editors like CoderPad or HackerRank
Interviewer evaluates problem-solving approach and communication

rounds.name: DSA Round 2 / Full-Stack Fundamentals
points: Could be another DSA round or deep dive into JavaScript/Node.js internals
Frontend topics: closures, prototypes, event loop, React reconciliation
Backend topics: async patterns, middleware, database transactions
Write code to demonstrate concepts (e.g., implement debounce, Promise.all)

rounds.name: Machine Coding / Full-Stack Round
points: Build a complete feature: user dashboard, chat app, or booking system
Frontend: React with proper component structure and state management
Backend: REST API with Express, database operations, authentication
Focus on code organization, reusability, and handling edge cases

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Bar Raiser
points: Behavioral questions using STAR format (Situation, Task, Action, Result)
Deep dive into your best full-stack project - technical decisions and trade-offs
Questions about handling challenges, tight deadlines, and collaboration
Culture fit assessment - research company values beforehand

easy: Focus on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and basic Node.js fundamentals
Practice basic coding problems for aptitude tests
Prepare clear explanations of your full-stack projects
doable: Strengthen your core skills - HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js
Learn MERN basics and build simple full-stack applications
Practice common interview questions and coding basics
challenging: Solid understanding of web fundamentals and basic backend is essential
Build a few portfolio projects to showcase full-stack capability
Focus on communication and explaining concepts clearly
stretch: Service companies are typically entry-friendly for full-stack roles
Focus on fundamentals over advanced concepts
This should be very achievable with basic preparation

rounds.name: Aptitude & Online Test
points: Quantitative aptitude, logical reasoning, and verbal ability
1-2 easy coding problems (basic loops, conditionals, arrays)
MCQs on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, and database basics
Focus on accuracy over speed - cutoff-based filtering

rounds.name: Technical Interview 1
points: Frontend questions: HTML tags, CSS selectors, JavaScript syntax
Backend questions: Node.js basics, REST API concepts, SQL queries
Explain concepts: var vs let vs const, callback vs promise, GET vs POST
Project discussion - be ready to explain your contributions clearly

rounds.name: Technical Interview 2
points: Deeper dive into JavaScript: closures, hoisting, async/await
React questions if on your resume: JSX, props, state, hooks
Node.js questions: Express middleware, routing, error handling
May ask to build a simple API endpoint or debug existing code

rounds.name: HR Interview
points: Standard questions: strengths, weaknesses, why this company
Career goals and willingness to learn new technologies
Salary expectations (be realistic for fresher full-stack roles)
Relocation flexibility and notice period discussion

easy: Maintain strong DSA practice - solve problems regularly
Prepare for full-stack system design discussions
Practice behavioral interviews with STAR format
doable: DSA is the primary filter - solve 150+ LeetCode problems
Master both frontend and backend, including architecture principles
Build impressive full-stack portfolio projects with production quality
challenging: DSA mastery is mandatory - aim for 200+ problems (medium/hard)
Deep full-stack system design knowledge is expected
Strong referrals are almost essential - network actively
stretch: This is the highest bar - plan for 8+ months of intense prep
DSA at expert level is non-negotiable
Consider building 1-2 years of experience first

rounds.name: Recruiter Screen
points: Initial call to verify your background and interest
Overview of the interview process and timeline
Questions about visa status, location preferences, start date
Opportunity to ask about the team and role expectations

rounds.name: Phone/Online Technical Screen
points: 1-2 coding problems on shared editor (CoderPad, Google Docs)
Medium difficulty - arrays, strings, hash maps, or trees
Focus on clean code, edge cases, and optimal time complexity
Strong communication is essential - think out loud throughout

rounds.name: Onsite: Coding Round 1
points: Medium to hard DSA problem with live whiteboard or code editor
Common topics: dynamic programming, trees, graphs, recursion
Interviewer evaluates problem breakdown and optimization
Expect follow-up questions to extend or modify your solution

rounds.name: Onsite: Coding Round 2
points: Another DSA problem, potentially harder or different domain
May involve advanced data structures or complex logic
Write clean, bug-free code under time pressure
Discuss multiple approaches before settling on implementation

rounds.name: Onsite: Full-Stack System Design
points: Design a full-stack system: social feed, e-commerce checkout, chat app
Cover frontend architecture, API design, database schema, caching
Discuss performance: lazy loading, code splitting, database indexing
Address authentication, error handling, scalability, and edge cases

rounds.name: Onsite: Behavioral / Leadership
points: Amazon: Leadership Principles with STAR format
Google: Googleyness - collaboration, growth mindset, adaptability
Prepare stories about ownership, conflict, learning from failure
Questions like 'Tell me about a time you had to learn something new quickly'

rounds.name: Hiring Committee & Team Match
points: Google: Packet reviewed by hiring committee for final decision
Amazon: Bar raiser provides independent assessment
Team matching calls to find mutual fit
Process can take 2-4 weeks post-onsite

phases.title: Frontend Fundamentals

whatYouLearn.title: HTML5 & Semantic Markup
whatYouLearn.description: Master semantic tags, forms, accessibility, and SEO-friendly HTML structure

whatYouLearn.title: CSS3 & Responsive Design
whatYouLearn.description: Flexbox, Grid, media queries, mobile-first design, CSS variables, and animations

whatYouLearn.title: JavaScript ES6+ Fundamentals
whatYouLearn.description: Variables, functions, arrays, objects, async/await, promises, modules, DOM manipulation

phases.target: Build responsive, interactive web pages from scratch
whyItMatters: Essential for any web development role
Core interview topics at all companies

phases.title: Backend Development with Node.js

whatYouLearn.title: Node.js & Express Fundamentals
whatYouLearn.description: Server setup, routing, middleware, error handling, and async patterns

whatYouLearn.title: Databases: SQL & NoSQL
whatYouLearn.description: PostgreSQL for relational data, MongoDB for document storage, database design basics

whatYouLearn.title: REST API Development
whatYouLearn.description: Build RESTful APIs, handle CRUD operations, authentication with JWT, API security

phases.target: Build a production-ready backend API with database integration
whyItMatters: Node.js is the most popular choice for full-stack JavaScript
Essential skill for MERN/MEAN stack roles

phases.title: Full-Stack Integration with React

whatYouLearn.title: React & Modern Frontend Frameworks
whatYouLearn.description: Components, JSX, props, state, hooks (useState, useEffect), React Router

whatYouLearn.title: State Management & API Integration
whatYouLearn.description: Context API, Redux basics, fetch data from REST APIs, handle loading states

whatYouLearn.title: Authentication & Authorization
whatYouLearn.description: User registration/login flows, JWT tokens, protected routes, role-based access

phases.target: Build a complete full-stack application with auth and database
whyItMatters: React + Node.js is the most in-demand full-stack combination
Understanding the full request-response cycle is crucial
Authentication is required in almost all real-world applications

phases.title: Deployment, DevOps & Portfolio

whatYouLearn.title: Deployment & Cloud Basics
whatYouLearn.description: Deploy to Vercel/Netlify (frontend), Heroku/Railway (backend), AWS/GCP fundamentals

whatYouLearn.title: DevOps Essentials
whatYouLearn.description: Git workflows, Docker basics, CI/CD with GitHub Actions, environment variables

whatYouLearn.title: Testing & Best Practices
whatYouLearn.description: Unit testing with Jest, integration testing, error handling, logging, code quality

phases.target: Deploy production-ready full-stack apps and build strong portfolio
whyItMatters: DevOps skills are increasingly expected from full-stack developers
Strong portfolio sets you apart from other candidates

projects.title: Full-Stack Todo App with Authentication
projects.description: Build a complete MERN stack todo application with user authentication, CRUD operations, and deployment
projects.shortDescription: MERN todo app with auth and database persistence
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-quality full-stack todo application using the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js). Implement user registration/login with JWT authentication, CRUD operations for todos, user-specific data isolation, and deploy both frontend and backend. This project teaches the complete full-stack development cycle from database to deployment.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Project Structure
implementationSteps.description: Create two separate folders: /client for React frontend (using Vite or Create React App) and /server for Node.js backend. Initialize package.json for both. Backend: install express, mongoose, jsonwebtoken, bcrypt, dotenv, cors. Frontend: install axios, react-router-dom. Set up basic folder structure: client/src/components, server/routes, server/models, server/controllers.

implementationSteps.title: Build Backend API with Express & MongoDB
implementationSteps.description: Set up Express server with CORS middleware. Connect to MongoDB using Mongoose. Create User model (email, password hash, createdAt) and Todo model (userId, title, completed, createdAt). Build authentication endpoints: POST /api/auth/register (hash password with bcrypt), POST /api/auth/login (verify credentials, return JWT). Create middleware to verify JWT tokens.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Todo CRUD Endpoints
implementationSteps.description: Build protected todo routes (require JWT authentication): GET /api/todos (fetch user's todos), POST /api/todos (create todo), PUT /api/todos/:id (update todo), DELETE /api/todos/:id (delete todo). Ensure todos are user-specific by filtering by userId from JWT token. Add validation: title required, completed boolean. Test all endpoints with Postman or Thunder Client.

implementationSteps.title: Build React Frontend with Authentication
implementationSteps.description: Create authentication pages: Login.jsx and Register.jsx with controlled forms. Store JWT token in localStorage on successful login. Build protected routes using React Router - redirect to login if no token. Create AuthContext to share user state globally. Add axios interceptor to automatically attach JWT token to all API requests in Authorization header.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Todo UI & State Management
implementationSteps.description: Build TodoList component that fetches todos from backend on mount. Create TodoItem component with toggle complete and delete buttons. Build AddTodoForm with controlled input. Use useState for todos array and loading states. On add/update/delete, optimistically update UI then sync with backend. Handle errors gracefully with user-friendly messages.

implementationSteps.title: Deploy Full-Stack Application
implementationSteps.description: Frontend: Deploy to Vercel or Netlify with environment variable for API URL. Backend: Deploy to Render, Railway, or Heroku. Set up MongoDB Atlas for cloud database. Configure CORS to allow requests from deployed frontend domain. Add environment variables for JWT_SECRET, MONGO_URI. Test the deployed application end-to-end. Add README with architecture diagram and setup instructions.

projects.title: Blog Platform with Rich Editor
projects.description: Create a full-featured blog platform with markdown editor, comments, likes, and user profiles
projects.shortDescription: Full-stack blog with markdown, comments, and social features
projects.fullDescription: Build a modern blogging platform similar to Medium or Dev.to. Implement user authentication, rich markdown editor for posts, commenting system, like/bookmark functionality, and user profiles. This intermediate project demonstrates complex state management, advanced React patterns, and building social features with proper data relationships in the database.

implementationSteps.title: Design Database Schema & API Structure
implementationSteps.description: Plan MongoDB collections: Users (username, email, password, bio, avatar, followers), Posts (authorId, title, content, tags, publishedAt, likes count), Comments (postId, authorId, content, createdAt), Likes (userId, postId, createdAt). Design RESTful API routes: /posts, /posts/:id, /posts/:id/comments, /posts/:id/like, /users/:username. Consider pagination for posts and comments.

implementationSteps.title: Build Backend with Advanced Features
implementationSteps.description: Implement post CRUD endpoints with populate() to include author details. Add pagination and filtering: GET /posts?page=1&limit=10&tag=javascript. Build like toggle endpoint using atomic operations (increment/decrement likes count). Implement commenting system with nested replies support. Add user profile endpoint with aggregation to count posts and followers.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Markdown Editor & Rendering
implementationSteps.description: Frontend: integrate react-markdown or react-simplemde-editor for markdown writing. Add preview mode to show rendered markdown. Implement syntax highlighting for code blocks using highlight.js or prism. Add toolbar for common markdown operations (bold, italic, headings, links, images). Store raw markdown in database, render on display.

implementationSteps.title: Build Image Upload & Tag System
implementationSteps.description: Implement image upload for cover images and in-post images. Use Cloudinary or AWS S3 for storage. Build tag system: users can add tags to posts, clicking tag shows all posts with that tag. Create tag autocomplete based on existing tags. Build search functionality: search posts by title, content, or tags using text indexes in MongoDB.

implementationSteps.title: Add Social Features & Profiles
implementationSteps.description: Implement like button with optimistic updates and visual feedback. Build commenting interface with nested replies (2-level threading). Add user profiles showing their posts, followers count, bio. Implement follow/unfollow functionality. Build personalized feed showing posts from followed users. Add bookmarking feature to save posts for later.

implementationSteps.title: Optimize & Deploy
implementationSteps.description: Add SEO: dynamic meta tags for each post (title, description, og:image), generate sitemap. Implement lazy loading for images. Add reading time estimation. Create RSS feed for posts. Deploy frontend to Vercel with SSR using Next.js for better SEO. Deploy backend to Railway or Render. Set up CDN for images. Add analytics to track post views.

projects.title: E-Commerce Marketplace
projects.description: Build a complete e-commerce platform with product catalog, cart, checkout, payments, and admin dashboard
projects.shortDescription: Full-featured marketplace with cart, payments, and admin panel
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-grade e-commerce marketplace with all essential features: product browsing with filters and search, shopping cart with persistent state, multi-step checkout flow, payment integration with Stripe, order management, and admin dashboard for product/order management. This advanced project showcases handling complex business logic, payment processing, and building scalable full-stack applications.

implementationSteps.title: Design E-Commerce Database Schema
implementationSteps.description: Create MongoDB collections: Products (name, description, price, images, category, stock, brand, ratings), Users (email, password, addresses, orders), Cart (userId, items array with {productId, quantity, price}), Orders (userId, items, totalAmount, shippingAddress, paymentStatus, orderStatus, createdAt). Design for scalability: use references instead of embedding large arrays.

implementationSteps.title: Build Product Catalog API & Filtering
implementationSteps.description: Implement product endpoints: GET /products (with pagination, filtering by category/brand/price range, sorting by price/rating/newest), GET /products/:id, POST /products (admin only), PUT/DELETE /products/:id (admin). Build search using text indexes on name and description. Add aggregation pipeline for category-wise product counts and price range stats.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Shopping Cart & Checkout
implementationSteps.description: Build cart endpoints: GET /cart, POST /cart/add, PUT /cart/update/:productId, DELETE /cart/remove/:productId. Frontend: use Redux for global cart state synced with backend. Build multi-step checkout: (1) Review cart, (2) Shipping address form, (3) Payment method, (4) Order confirmation. Persist cart to database so it survives across devices and sessions.

implementationSteps.title: Integrate Stripe Payment Gateway
implementationSteps.description: Set up Stripe account and install stripe SDK. Create payment intent on backend: POST /create-payment-intent (amount, currency). Frontend: use @stripe/react-stripe-js to build checkout form with card element. On successful payment, create order record and send confirmation email. Handle webhooks for payment status updates. Implement refund functionality for order cancellations.

implementationSteps.title: Build Order Management & Admin Dashboard
implementationSteps.description: Create order endpoints: GET /orders (user's orders), GET /orders/:id (order details with tracking). Admin endpoints: GET /admin/orders (all orders with filters), PUT /admin/orders/:id/status (update order status: processing/shipped/delivered). Build admin dashboard UI: product CRUD table, order management panel, sales analytics charts (daily/weekly revenue). Use role-based access control (admin vs customer).

implementationSteps.title: Add Reviews, Recommendations & Deploy
implementationSteps.description: Implement product review system: POST /products/:id/reviews, calculate average rating. Build recommendation engine: show related products based on category, show recently viewed items. Add inventory management: decrease stock on purchase, prevent ordering out-of-stock items. Deploy: frontend to Vercel, backend to Render with MongoDB Atlas. Set up Stripe production mode. Add order tracking emails using SendGrid. Implement caching for product listings using Redis.
